quotes:
[]Author: David St;
Rating: 5
When: 4 months ago
Great hotel near the Vatican. The hotel was close to public transport and where the locals ate. So getting an authentic Local experience and food was simple.

Author: Amanda Rose;
Rating: 4
When: a year ago
Overall we enjoyed our experience. Rooms were clean and nice. Staff met accommodations. We only ate there for morning breakfast which was the same each morning. Not many additional amenities to the hotel. Very close to Vatican but far from other tourists stops

Author: M G;
Rating: 4
When: a year ago
Elegant hotel located on a 5 minute walk from St. Peter's square. We received a room upgrade upon arrival, which was a nice gesture. If possible get a room with balcony as you can see the Dome from there. The hotel is spotlessly clean and the room was spacious and well-equipped as compared to other Rome hotels we have visited. The hotel's staff was courteous and welcoming (apart for some of the waitresses at the restaurant, who were not very attentive - e.g. they would not ask if you need anything like espresso). The hotel is in a very convenient and quiet location. One thing that could be improved is the breakfast - while the variety was satisfactory, it was one and the same each morning. The New Year's buffet dinner was a bit of a disappointment - the mood was not particularly festive and it closed before the start of the new year. Food was also a bit on the bland side.

Author: Bob P.;
Rating: 4
When: a year ago
Great location near everything! Friendly staff with good english. That's important to me since I'm totally ignorant of other languages. I might have been " put on the elevator" a bit due to a "reservation foul-up" that wouldn't make the room price I had reserved available for 2 days. They gave me an "upgraded" room for the first 2 days for the original price but said I would either have to move to the cheaper room after that or pay the upgraded price to stay in the original room. I decided to stay put. Who wants to pack up and move? Long story short it might have been a simple bait and switch type of thing, but I'm not sure. Oh, the room is nice but I don't know what the "upgrade might be". Recommend none the less.

Author: Kate Heltemes;
Rating: 5
When: a year ago
This was our favorite hotel of our European vacation. Very clean and spacious, although I think we had one of the better rooms. Bathroom was great. We had a balcony in the room and a balcony in the bathroom. We did some sink laundry and let it dry in the balcony. This was our plan so we wouldn't have to pack as much clothing. It was easy to catch an uber or taco from this hotel. Walking distance to the subway which was easy to use. We were able to travel to many destinations by walking it taking the subway. I recommend getting a subway ticket that includes unlimited rides for x amount of time. I think we did 48 hours. Breakfast had many options and was very good. While Rome itself was very dirty with trash pretty much all over this hotel was very clean inside and out. I would definitely return to this hotel.

[]Author: Kim Koch Rasmussen;
Rating: 5
When: 9 months ago
Very interesting place to visit - you will see a lot, and end the tour in the Vatican Grotto with easy access to Saint Peter's Basilica. Highly recommended

Author: Oliver Stothert;
Rating: 1
When: 5 months ago
Nice place, just a shame the pope is a nonce

Author: Eva;
Rating: 5
When: a year ago
A very special place with a fascinating history. Outside off the beaten tourist paths. But don't think it's cold 12 meters under the ground! It is very humid and warm to preserve the original conditions (according to the archeologist). With outside 33 degrees it had approximately the same here, better bring something to drink.

Author: Hagop Araklian;
Rating: 5
When: a year ago
Being in Rome, Vatican is must visited, beautiful Cathedral and astonishing museum. Plz consider a long day due to queue and absolutely many spot to be discovered.

Author: Damien Gill;
Rating: 5
When: a year ago
Unique way to visit and see areas of the vatican that you will not be able to see from the normal "public" access to the basilica above. Guide is very knowledgeable and you need to book couple of months in advance of your trip. Highly recommend it as it is very inexpensive but also very , very unique.

[]Author: Thomas Sallermann;
Rating: 4
When: 6 months ago
This is the most important place in Roman Catholicism. The building in itself is quite impressive. You can discover lots of beautiful art. Fortunately not all the moneyüí∂ made by the church is given to the poor. It seems that comparatively few people come here to pray (I discovered some nuns in a small chapel doing this). Please wear the masküò∑. Protect the Vatican.

Author: Vedat Odacƒ±;
Rating: 4
When: 2 months ago
We can call St. Peter's Basilica as the most important Catholic House of Worship in the world. Just as the Kaaba is important for Muslims, St. Peter's Basilica is of similar importance to Christians. The only difference is that in addition to its religious importance, this place is also interesting in terms of art and tourism. The basilica, one of the 12 apostles of Christ and built on the tomb of St. Peter's (or at least the tomb of the person thought to be St. It is also one of the most important stops of travel. Being the largest church in the world in terms of its area of ‚Äã‚Äãcoverage, St. In addition to being a religious building, Peter‚Äôs Basilica is an exquisite example of Renaissance architecture and perhaps the most expensive artworks in the world. Located in the heart of the Vatican, in St. Peter's Square (St. Peter's Square or St. Peter's Square), St. Peter's Basilica is an important and striking structure with its interior, exterior, underground part, in short, with every centimeter.

Author: Al Dhalla;
Rating: 5
When: 2 months ago
It was an incredible experience. We joined a tour group. They picked us up from the hotel and they assisted us through the security and had preferred seating for us. We attended a mass. We had a great view of the Pope as he entered the area and took some great photos. After the mass, we walked around, visited the gift shop, got some lunch and went back to our hotel. Overall great visit and highly recommended. Thank you.

Author: Philip Kearns;
Rating: 5
When: 8 months ago
Really needs to be seen to be appreciated. No church in the world comes close to its grandeur, history and magnificence, and visiting is completely free! Regardless of your religion do not visit Rome without taking the time to visit St Peters. I recommend getting either a tour or an audio guide to really get an appreciation of the various art works and historical artefacts. One of the lesser appreciated pieces that I found interesting and beautiful was the massive porphyry baptism font. Of course climbing the cupola is definitely worth the time and effort as well.

Author: Sachin Vats;
Rating: 5
When: in the last week
What a wonderful Architecture. It is so magnificent and has wow effect. The whole area make you wonder how it was planned and built so beautifully. A great demonstration of art and very religious place of worship for catholics around the world. People travel here from around the world to see Rome and see the St Peter's Bassilica. A must visit place in Rome, Italy.

[]Author: David Herbst;
Rating: 3
When: 4 months ago
I can appreciate the history behind it but I fail to understand why the ceiling of this place seems to be one of the highlights of Rome. If you can, be sure to do the entire tour of the Vatican Museum. Along your way you will see dozens of long hallways with tall ceilings, all of which are painted with beautiful art. Don't rush to see it, rather enjoy all the other beautiful art Rome shows you just by walking anywhere.

Author: Dmitriy Mitin;
Rating: 5
When: 8 months ago
This place has already more than 32k reviews, so I don't think I could add something new. I was blessed to visit this place during the pandemic - it was so calm and peaceful without tourists. As a short remark - if you take an audio guide, the content will be different for different languages. The most complete is Italian and English.

Author: heath;
Rating: 4
When: a week ago
The most magnificent architecture in Rome. The paintings were fascinating. The whole experience was engaging. My only complaint is that some in my family are claustrophobic, and they were letting way too many people into a room at a time. They packed some rooms full so that there was virtually no room. Other than that, it was an amazing experience.

Author: Karen Blanco;
Rating: 5
When: 8 months ago
A must see. So much art and so much more. Tons of stolen relics from other cultures are on display here. This is the Louvre of Italy, if you like seeing everything you may need a full day or two

Author: Elena Vidotto;
Rating: 5
When: 6 months ago
I took the audio guide and It was saying all or even more than what was supposed to. The chapel is amazing but I believe without a guide you wouldn't appreciate it as much as you should. I mean only if you are a normal person who doesn't know that much about Michelangelo and the history of the Sistine chapel.

[]Author: Jaydeep Ravani;
Rating: 5
When: 8 months ago
The museum consists of two large sections: - the Historical Museum proper, which is located in the Lateran Palace; it preserves an iconographic series of the Popes from the sixteenth century to today; the most significant finds from the papal military corps, the Chapel and the Papal Family, and the various papal ceremonials no longer in use; - the Carriage Pavilion, located in the Vatican Museums, where the testimonies concerning papal mobility (the popemobiles) are preserved, that is saddles, sedan chairs, carriages, cars, all accompanied by paintings and photographs. The entrance ticket to the Vatican Museums entitles you to visit the Vatican Museums and Sistine Chapel for the day of issue only and allows you to visit, within the following 5 days (including the day of issue), the Historical Museum and the Noble Apartment of the Lateran Apostolic Palace in Piazza S. Giovanni in Laterano.

Rating: 5
When: 3 years ago
A hidden gem of the Vatican museum dedicated to popes. Zero people, interesting collection, great presentation, very worth a visit.

[]Author: Claudia Andrea C;
Rating: 5
When: 8 months ago
A must! I would highly recommend to assign half a day to the museums, in order to see everything inside. It is really big and it could take a while to finish it. Take comfy shoes because you will walk a lot. Also don't forget your water.

Author: James Blassingame;
Rating: 5
When: 7 months ago
If you find yourself in Rome, do what the Romans do.........check out The Vatican!!! The earlier in the day that you can get there the better off you will be. This place gets PACKED!!! Not really an issue right now, but when school is in session the school groups swamp the place, and that's not even mentioning regular tourist. The setting is immaculate, absolutely beautiful. One thing that I noticed, there was a legit military/law enforcement presence at the Vatican. If someone is going there with the intention of breaking bad, I pray for their soul. The armed guards aren't playing, and looked legit as any military operation I can think of. The Sistine Chapel is a sight to behold, worth the churning herd of people to see it in person. Don't pull your cameras out, they don't take too kindly to that either. This isn't from personal experience, but I didn't see some people who encountered issues.

Author: Angelos Odyseakis;
Rating: 5
When: 7 months ago
Amazing experience, but very crowded.

Author: Mrs Mrs;
Rating: 5
When: 6 months ago
A fantastic museum that is like a time capsule. There are displays that go back as far as Constantine, all the way up to the present day. We were lucky enough to have come on an evening tour and the museum was not crowded. Our tour guide was able to give fantastic insight into the pieces of art and relics on display. The artwork on the ceiling is amazing, it looks like 3D plaster but it's not it's actually all hand painted!

Rating: 5

One of the best kept museums. Vatican is smallest country but it never stopped them from building one of the world's largest museum. Buy tickets online and avoid large crowds at the queues

Author: Levent Parman;
Rating: 4
When: 10 months ago
Jazz¬†is a¬†music genre¬†that originated in the¬†African-American¬†communities of¬†New Orleans, United States, in the late 19th and early 20th centuries, with its roots in¬†blues¬†and¬†ragtime.¬†Since the 1920s¬†Jazz Age, it has been recognized as a major form of musical expression in¬†traditional¬†and¬†popular music, linked by the common bonds of African-American and¬†European-American¬†musical parentage.¬†Jazz is characterized by¬†swing¬†and¬†blue notes,¬†call and response vocals,¬†polyrhythms¬†and¬†improvisation. Jazz has roots in¬†West African cultural and musical expression, and in¬†African-American music traditions.As jazz spread around the world, it drew on national, regional, and local musical cultures, which gave rise to different styles.¬†New Orleans jazz¬†began in the early 1910s, combining earlier brass-band marches, French¬†quadrilles,¬†biguine, ragtime and¬†blues¬†with collective¬†polyphonic¬†improvisation. In the 1930s, heavily arranged dance-oriented¬†swing¬†big bands,¬†Kansas City jazz, a hard-swinging, bluesy, improvisational style and¬†Gypsy jazz¬†(a style that emphasized¬†musette¬†waltzes) were the prominent styles.¬†Bebop¬†emerged in the 1940s, shifting jazz from danceable popular music toward a more challenging "musician's music" which was played at faster tempos and used more chord-based improvisation.¬†Cool jazz¬†developed near the end of the 1940s, introducing calmer, smoother sounds and long, linear melodic lines. The mid-1950s saw the emergence of¬†hard bop, which introduced influences from¬†rhythm and blues,¬†gospel, and blues, especially in the saxophone and piano playing.¬†Modal jazz¬†developed in the late 1950s, using the¬†mode, or musical scale, as the basis of musical structure and improvisation, as did¬†free jazz, which explored playing without regular meter, beat and formal structures.¬†Jazz-rock fusion¬†appeared in the late 1960s and early 1970s, combining jazz improvisation with¬†rock music's rhythms, electric instruments, and highly amplified stage sound. In the early 1980s, a commercial form of jazz fusion called¬†smooth jazz¬†became successful, garnering significant radio airplay. Other styles and genres abound in the 2000s, such as¬†Latin¬†and¬†Afro-Cuban jazz.

Author: Maja Wis;
Rating: 3
When: 7 months ago
I guess the best part is restricted. The accessible bit is ok, you can see the wealth of Vatican poured into maintenance while keeping it "simple" at the same time

Author: Call Me M.;
Rating: 5
When: 5 months ago
Probably one of the most beautiful spots in Rome. It's a quiet, relaxing place that is filled with exquisite art from all over the world. foreign trees and parrots (that were gifts to the Popes) also make up most of the fauna and flora. interestingly there are also some greek gods portraied in there! I highly suggest you take time to visit the Vatican Gardens, its worth every penny and second spent in there!

Author: Dan (DV);
Rating: 5
When: a year ago
The bus tour was great, especially for the end of December when it can get cold. The bus had a plastic cover so you don't face any wind. There was practically no queue. You're allowed in with ~45 minutes before the time on the ticket and in no time you're past the scanners. There are separate counters from where you can get the tickets insinde the building (almost no line). When the tour is done, you can visit the rest of the museum; no other waiting involved.

[]Author: David St;
Rating: 5
When: 4 months ago
Great hotel near the Vatican. The hotel was close to public transport and where the locals ate. So getting an authentic Local experience and food was simple.

Author: Amanda Rose;
Rating: 4
When: a year ago
Overall we enjoyed our experience. Rooms were clean and nice. Staff met accommodations. We only ate there for morning breakfast which was the same each morning. Not many additional amenities to the hotel. Very close to Vatican but far from other tourists stops

Author: M G;
Rating: 4
When: a year ago
Elegant hotel located on a 5 minute walk from St. Peter's square. We received a room upgrade upon arrival, which was a nice gesture. If possible get a room with balcony as you can see the Dome from there. The hotel is spotlessly clean and the room was spacious and well-equipped as compared to other Rome hotels we have visited. The hotel's staff was courteous and welcoming (apart for some of the waitresses at the restaurant, who were not very attentive - e.g. they would not ask if you need anything like espresso). The hotel is in a very convenient and quiet location. One thing that could be improved is the breakfast - while the variety was satisfactory, it was one and the same each morning. The New Year's buffet dinner was a bit of a disappointment - the mood was not particularly festive and it closed before the start of the new year. Food was also a bit on the bland side.

Author: Bob P.;
Rating: 4
When: a year ago
Great location near everything! Friendly staff with good english. That's important to me since I'm totally ignorant of other languages. I might have been " put on the elevator" a bit due to a "reservation foul-up" that wouldn't make the room price I had reserved available for 2 days. They gave me an "upgraded" room for the first 2 days for the original price but said I would either have to move to the cheaper room after that or pay the upgraded price to stay in the original room. I decided to stay put. Who wants to pack up and move? Long story short it might have been a simple bait and switch type of thing, but I'm not sure. Oh, the room is nice but I don't know what the "upgrade might be". Recommend none the less.

Author: Kate Heltemes;
Rating: 5
When: a year ago
This was our favorite hotel of our European vacation. Very clean and spacious, although I think we had one of the better rooms. Bathroom was great. We had a balcony in the room and a balcony in the bathroom. We did some sink laundry and let it dry in the balcony. This was our plan so we wouldn't have to pack as much clothing. It was easy to catch an uber or taco from this hotel. Walking distance to the subway which was easy to use. We were able to travel to many destinations by walking it taking the subway. I recommend getting a subway ticket that includes unlimited rides for x amount of time. I think we did 48 hours. Breakfast had many options and was very good. While Rome itself was very dirty with trash pretty much all over this hotel was very clean inside and out. I would definitely return to this hotel.
